titleNullable: Corrective re-annotation of FER - CK+ - KDEF
subtitleNullable: Correctly re-annotated images for Facial Expression Recognition
descriptionNullable:
### Context


Many machine learning models for facial expression recognition use industry standard datasets like FER, CK+ and KDEF. However, on manual inspection, it was found that several images in the standard datasets were mis-categorized. This is an attempt towards corrective manual re-annotation of the images for better model training. 


### Content

There are 32,900 + images with 8 emotions categories – anger, contempt, disgust, fear, happiness, neutrality, sadness and surprise. All images contain grayscale human face (or sketch). Each image is 224 x 224 pixel grayscale in PNG format. 


### Acknowledgements

Sources for the base datasets, on whom manual re-annotation was done: 
1.	FER Dataset: https://www.kaggle.com/c/challenges-in-representation-learning-facial-expression-recognition-challenge
2.	CK Plus Dataset: https://github.com/WuJie1010/Facial-Expression-Recognition.Pytorch/tree/master/CK%2B48 
3.	KDEF Dataset: https://www.kdef.se/download-2/register.html 


### Inspiration

Quest to see if model accuracy for Facial Expression Recognition can be improved by correct re-annotation of the images.
